boardgame.name: Sagrada: Promo 17 – Gathering of Friends 2021 Window Pattern Card
boardgame.description: A new promotional, double-sided window pattern card distributed at Alan R. Moon's annual Gathering of Friends in 2021.

boardgame.name: EXIT Adventskalender: Der verborgene Mayatempel
boardgame.description:
In each of the 24 compartments of the Exit Advent Calendar for ages 10 and up, a tricky puzzle challenges the player. To find the right door for the following day, the puzzle must be solved in the room. To do this, clues can be found in the richly detailed illustrated compartments, on a total of 47 puzzle cards with a wide variety of puzzle types. Who cleverly combines, finds the solution, and thus to the symbol of the following door. This is the mission: In a yellowed letter from 1803, which appears in a historical atlas, the explorer Lord Ernest Pickleton reports on a hidden Maya temple in Guatemala. Its exact location, however, is a mystery to be explored. Exploring the hidden temple is a challenge: only one room may be entered each day. The journey was successful if the heart of the temple was found within 24 days.

Now clever powers of deduction and creativity are required. Each family member can contribute his strengths. But don't worry, if you get stuck, a table on the back of the pack with 2 hints per puzzle and a breakdown of the solution will help.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

boardgame.name: EXIT Adventskalender Kids: Dschungel-Abenteuer
boardgame.description:
To find the right door for the following day, the puzzle of the day must be solved. This can be found on each of the detailed illustrated cards in the tray. Find the solution and thus the symbol of the following door. In this exciting Advent calendar, children from the age of 6 can immerse themselves in the Exit world full of puzzles and secrets. A total of 24 entertaining tasks lead through an exciting and unforgettable adventure into the depths of the jungle. Only those who crack the picture puzzle of the day and find the symbol for the following door will get closer to the secret of the jungle.

This is the mission: the world-famous naturalist Professor Humbelhopf travels into the jungle in search of very special species of monkeys. At his side you will meet numerous animals and have to face exciting challenges. Every day there is a new task to pass. The adventure is considered successfully completed when the entire band of monkeys has been collected. Who dares the eventful journey of exploration into the wild jungle?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

boardgame.name: War of Crown: The Battle of XuanWu Gate
boardgame.description:
War of Crown explores a historical tragedy where players assume the role of 3 princes from the bloody battle of Xuanwu Gate. As an eligible prince to the throne, how will you win over the emperor’s heart? Will you manage political affairs, lead military campaigns, or undermine your opponent with schemes? One thing you know for sure, this war of crown will end with you on the throne, blood shed or not.

Essentially it is a Roundel game where the players move their pawn on the Chang’an city in a clockwise manner. The locations let the players (princes) gain gold from the emperor, use the gold to recruit the most basic resources which are the subordinates (followers, military units and spies), then using these “resources” to creat network with the Character Cards (Ministers, Concubines and Generals), which in turn gives the players Political influences, Military influences and Scheme abilities for which the players will be able to use them to gain Victory Points by completing Emperors Tasks, go on military campaigns and sabotage each other. The player with most VP wins the game.

Alternatively, players could try to coup the other players. It’s a risky move that involves drawing random cubes from your own plot bag (that you try to manage throughout the game). If successful, you win the game instantaneously, however if you fail, you lost the game.

boardgame.name: Explorers of the Woodlands
boardgame.description:
Explorers of the Woodlands is a forest-themed cooperative dice game / dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players. It combines all the best of tile placement, exploration, rolling dice and bashing monsters in a gorgeous setting, and comes with a fast paced classic game mode and a campaign mode.

Gameplay: In classic game mode, players will explore a forest of over 20 tiles. At the end of each forest, a boss will spawn and the players will have to defeat it to win the game!

During the Exploration phase, each player adds one tile to the Forest, making it bigger and bigger.
During the Adventure phase, each player will play their character in turn order. The active player rolls 4 hero dice and places them on their hero board to select and know what actions can be performed for the turn.

Depending on the dice results, players get moves, special actions and unique abilities!
Loot cards acquired while killing monsters or found in the forest and during events will also help the heroes reach their goal!

In addition to the standard game mode, the game comes with a 5-mission campaign with different objectives, special rules and components for an even greater replay value.

boardgame.name: World of MiniMonsters
boardgame.description: World of MiniMonsters is a game of collecting and leveling creatures where you will reach the glory fighting in fast-paced battles.

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Monkey Companion
boardgame.description:
The Monkey is the first companion in the game that learns. She shows particular interest in tools and construction, quickly becoming the perfect assistant for the Build action.

At first, the Monkey lacks skills and spends more Wood than necessary to finish the job. But with every new completed task, she gains experience and efficiency, turning into not only a friend, but also a great little Building helper.

We liked the Monkey so much that we created a separate new Scenario for her and the remaining animal companions which you will find in The Book of Adventures.

This addon contains a plastic figure for the Monkey, so all the companions you add to the game look equally great. The card and a wooden pawn for the Monkey are already included in the Collector's Edition and the Upgrade Pack as a surprise bonus.

This new friend on the island is a companion, which brings additional help and can be used to make the game easier. You can modify the difficulty of the game by adding or removing different companions (Horse, Parrot, Cat, Monkey) and combine them in any set you prefer. Each companion makes the game slightly easier.

The Monkey figure will fit into the box of Robinson Crusoe: Collector's Edition / Upgrade Pack.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Collector's Edition (Gamefound Edition)
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Collector's Edition Upgrade Pack
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – The Book of Adventures
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – The Book of Adventures (Gamefound Edition)

boardgame.name: Vakantielandenspel: België
boardgame.description:
Name translates to 'Highlights of the Game: Belgium', part of a series of such games with different countries being the subject.

This is a game where you can show off your knowledge of Belgium by answering questions on History, Art, Culture, Sport and Food.By answering questions correctly, and with a little luck, you will collect souvenirs of the country.

The game consists of 48 question cards, 30 souvenir cards, one round ard, 1 rules card and 1 pamphlet with informative background information about your holiday destination.

On each card there are questions in 5 categories and each is designated with its own icon and colour. The five categories in full are;
Eten en Drinken (Green) - Eating and Drinking
Geschiedenis (Yellow) - History
Sport, Spel en Vakantie (Orange) - Sport, Games and Holidays
Kunst en Cultuur (Red) - Art and Culture
Stad en Land (Blue) - Cities and Countries

On each card the category questions are in a different order. On the back of each card are the answers. You play in rounds. The Round Card is placed on the bottom of the deck. You start with the first question on the card you have just drawn. If the Round Card is on the top of the deck, you put it back on the bottom and then ask the second question, and so on until 6 rounds have been played. On the question cards there are also commands, recognizable because the icon box is blank. These commands are on the lines of "Change a Souvenir to a different colour, Lose a souvenir, and so on.

The Question reader is the player to the left of the player whose turn it is. If the question is answered correctly, the player receives a souvenir in the same category of the question. If the player answers incorrectly then that player must lose a souvenir (if he has one) in that category. The question card is then placed on the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

Maximum number Souvenirs
The number of souvenirs that a player may have in a category is a a maximum of '2 players - 3', '3 or 4 players - 2'.. If a player gets a question in the category of which he already has reached the maximum, then he can choose a souvenir of any other category if he answers correctly. At the end of your turn you can exchange any 2 matching souvenir cards for one in any other category.

The winner is the first player to get souvenirs in all 5 categories

boardgame.name: Wild West Core
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A regular Wild West TTRPG that uses cards for conflict resolution.

boardgame.name: Firebox
boardgame.description:
A real-time railway building game for between 2 and 5 players.

Pick up and deliver your six passengers (miniature dice) to other players' stations, preferably by the longest and most interesting route possible (you get more points that way).

Each player has 16 matchsticks, a locomotive, six stations, six passengers and a tunnel/hill obstacle (they do need to provide their own pencil and paper, however). In real-time, they build end-to-end matchstick tracks connecting with other player networks and then shunt their passengers and locomotives to their destination stations.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Teatime Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion takes us to the world where murder is a little more genteel, and the detectives are a little less assuming. They may have silver in their hair and reading glasses on their nose, and the setting outside their windows are not the rain-slick streets but the quiet hills of England or the townships of New England. But murder is murder, even in quiet country hamlets...

boardgame.name: The Noir Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion brings the dark world of film noir to Partners cases. Suspects may die or double cross you, and a you may have to choose between a touch of evil or taking the big sleep...

boardgame.name: Lava Land
Лаваленд
boardgame.description:
Have you heard of Lava Land, a paradise island for tourists and explorers? There is plenty to enjoy: emerald plateaus with ancient temples, tropical fruit growing at every step, and the famous volcano erupting with lava… Wait, what?

On a tour to the main temple of the island, a rather nosy tourist pushed a peculiar lever… and the spirits of the island have awakened! You will be trying to save your lives and the relics of this island by outrunning the lava — with the help of the spirits, if you’re lucky, or hindrance… if not so lucky.

When (and if) you get back home, the World Island Culture Organization will happily accept your miraculously saved relics and offer a handsome reward for your bravery. On your way to the mainland, a continental breakfast you had in the morning will not be enough. Make sure to stash some food for the journey, but don’t drop your guard: your companions can fall victim to the mischievous spirits of the island and push you right into the boiling lava! Oh boy!



GAMEPLAY

1. Picking up dice — Simultaneously
All dice are rolled, and each player must take any three of them — one at a time, with one hand only — as fast as they can.
2. Resolving your combination — Taking turns
Each player resolves all effects of their combination: advancing along the corresponding tracks, purchasing cards, activating traps, and advancing lava!



GAME END

If you have 7 bananas, you may enter the rescue boat.
When all players are either in the boat or out of the race, the survivor with the most relics wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Sherlock File
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion adds new mechanics to focus on the ultimate Wild Card: the redoubtable Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective. The game is afoot, and Moriarty's hand is everywhere and only you and your doughty partner can uncover the intricate link between a single scuff on a pant leg and a threat to the Crown Heads of Europe...

boardgame.name: The Junior Detective File
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion puts the spotlight on the meddling kids who can't help but stumble onto mysteries. Budding Trixie Beldens and Nancy Drews will find new tables for more G-rated mysteries and clues and tips and suggestions for running the game with kids as young as six!

boardgame.name: Chilling Beasts of the Frozen Wastes
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb



Welcome Scavengers

Plunged into an unnatural, never-ending winter by the environmental catastrophe, monsters now roam toxic frozen lakes and stained snowy plains, watched over by scarred mountains.

As you well know, these monsters can hold valuable tags, if you can survive your encounters with them. Happy hunting, bring a coat.



Contents

Chilling Beasts of the Frozen Wastes is a Monster Guts supplement containing:



3 Chilling Monsters

- The terrifying Molemoth - a mole/mammoth hybrid liable to ambush unwary Scavengers from below

- The threatening Elephant Sneal - a venomous elephant seal with a hardy shell. Beware it's toxic ooze.

- The lethal Polarilla Stinger - a polar bear with powerful arms, and the tail of a scorpion. If you've found it's trail, it's probably already hunting you.



4 Dangerous Beasts



1 Icy Environment

boardgame.name: The Eldritch File
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion turns the Partners format to face not just murder but something darker. Something unnatural. Something that lurks in shadow and walks behind the rows. Not all of you will survive. Maybe nothing human will live to see the sun. The cards will decide.

boardgame.name: The Conspiracy! Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion turns the mystery into a conspiracy. No longer will evidence slowly pile up until the truth is inescapable. Clues will be removed. Evidence tampered with. Suspects eliminated. Confessions recanted. Powerful, shadowy figures don't want you to solve the case, but each new crime points slowly, inexorably, to the truth...

boardgame.name: Pidgzoth
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb



Welcome Scavengers

Pigeons easily survived the environmental collapse and still thrive in what used to be cities. Somehow one was infected by old magic and this monstrosity - Pidgzoth - came to exist.

It corrupts the environment, beasts and minds of scavengers around it. The Thralls it summons weaken and harm those that try to oppose it. Scavengers will find themselves battling to control themselves as well as defeat this monster.



Contents

Pidzoth is a Monster Guts supplement containing:



1 Nightmarish Monster

- The terrifying Pidgzoth - a corrupted pigeon that twists beasts and Scavengers to it's will.



2 Dangerous Beasts

boardgame.name: The Cyber Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Partners is a unique story-telling game where the plot is procedurally generated. Using random words and a regular playing card deck, two players will build their very own detective show, four suspects and a solution to the mystery even they won't see coming.

Although designed specifically for two players, the game can be played with one or many. You just need a deck of cards and a desire to butt heads and solve crimes.

This expansion takes the mystery to the neon-lit streets of our future - or is it the present now? Jack in, hack in and strap in for evil megacorps, cybercrime and technological dystopia. That does indeed sound like the present...

boardgame.name: The Cardinal Guardians
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Get ready to face off with a quartet of challenging monsters! The Cardinal Guardians are four monsters for MOSNTER GUTS that take inspiration from the Four Guardians of Japanese lore.

Also included is a surprise new weapon, the Monster Bashers!

boardgame.name: Vaesen GM Screen & Map
Vaesen Pantalla del Máster
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In dark forests, beyond the mountains, by black lakes in hidden groves. At your doorstep. In the shadows, something stirs. Strange beings. Twisted creatures, lurking at the edge of vision. Watching. Waiting. Unseen by most, but not by you. You see them for what they really are.

Vaesen.

Welcome to the Mythic North – northern Europe of the nineteenth century, but not as we know it today. A land where the myths are real. A cold reach covered by vast forests, its few cities lonely beacons of industry and enlightenment – a new civilization dawning. But in the countryside, the old ways still hold sway. There, people know what lurks in the dark.

They know to fear it.

Vaesen – Nordic Horror Roleplaying is written by Nils Hintze and based on the work of Swedish illustrator and author Johan Egerkrans, Vaesen presents a dark Gothic setting steeped in Nordic folklore and old myths of Scandinavia. The game mechanics use an adapted version of the award-winning Year Zero Engine.

A deluxe Gamemaster’s screen in landscape format for Vaesen – Nordic Horror Roleplaying. It features Johan Egerkrans’s art on the outside and a host of useful tables and important information on the inside, while keeping the GM’s plans hidden from the eyes of inquisitive players. Included in the package is also is a large double-sided poster featuring a beautiful map of the Mythic North setting on one side and the town of Upsala on the other (size 432x558mm).

boardgame.name: Project Alpha: Characters for the Youniverse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From legendary RPG designers Jonathan M. Thompson and Jacob Blackmon (author of the fan-favorite Super Powered Legends Line) comes a new hero team for your M&M game.

Project: Alpha is an elite group of superhumans created by the United States government to combat the
growing threat of superhuman criminals and terrorist organizations.

The founding, and current, members of the team include:
• Anony-Miss, an Israeli-American intelligence operative possessing a holographic cloaking suit that can turn her invisible or alter her appearance.
• Brainstorm, a young biochemist who was forced to consume his own experimental “mental enhancement” formula to keep it safe from terrorist hands.
• Jack of Spades, a physicist granted the ability to accelerate matter.
• Mystico, a sorcerer from Ancient Egypt resurrected and granted eternal life during the 1940s.
• Polar, a soldier whose mutation activated when exposed to an arctic blizzard.
• Cyber-Ninja. a soldier who has the unique ability to merge with an experimental suit of “mind-over-matter” armor.

boardgame.name: Sunset
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the face of an approaching danger and among throngs of crowds hoping to escape, an interstellar journalist goes missing, determined to find a “treasure.” His frantic wife hires the heroes to find him and get him safely offworld. But where do the PCs start looking? What is this enigmatic “treasure” that’s caused the reporter to risk life and limb? And will they live long enough to find out?

Sunset is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Fragments
boardgame.description:
You travel through time and space. Each jump, you embody a being of whom you feel his or her memories and feelings. Together, gather the fragments to know what you are doing here. Cooperate to create this reality.
Together, explore two different worlds : The post-apocalyptic world or the dimension of extraordinary people through 4 themes each.

An undead invasion
A natural disaster
A nuclear catastrophe
An alien encounter
The defense of your city
Protection of your world from the galaxy
The extraordinary people's school
The Evil brotherhood


For each game, you receive a character that you define in a few seconds to start the adventure.

At each round, draw a Word card and tell a fragment of story.
The Symbol-Icon match will affect favourably or negatively your adventure.
Your aim is to cooperate to create an unforgettable adventure.

A cooperative role playing game, without a game master nor preparation, focused on the story-telling and the power of the imagination of your group.
Modular length
Campaign mode
Infinite replayability
Short rules

boardgame.name: Legendary Shamans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spirits of Power

Legendary Shamans is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements for 5E, this time focusing on the master channelers of the spirit world known as shamans. This new class is a unique variant of the warlock that blends veneration of nature and the wild things that dwell therein with the myth and fantasy of animist shamanism. These divine spellcasters bind themselves to the spirits of this world rather than vast and mysterious extradimensional entities, with 16 spectacular options ranging from elemental spirits of earth and fire, wind and wood, to animal spirits like the raven, shark, and centipede. Shamans merge those spirits with themselves to become guardians of life or death, battle or community, ancestors or even time itself, and can specialize their skills with nearly 30 spirit boons like ominous chant, warding spirit, and speaker for the dead. This book also features complete spell lists for the shaman, including nearly two dozen new spells like split spirit, banishing blade, ancestral wrath, and seize the heart, as well as 10 magnificent magic items perfect for mastering the wild places of the world!

boardgame.name: Les Contes Émerveillés
boardgame.description:
The fairytales are all topsy turvy! A magical tornado has shaken everything up.
Create new stories to help the fairytales and gather enough stars to give them back their sparkle.

Each day, tell a story and bring the characters to life using the 7 variations available. You will create tales which are more and more goofy, moving and hectic.

Each story-teller gets an amount of Tale token with a unique symbol on it then the game is divided in two chapters.
Chapter 1, the storytellers pick a Character tile and place it face up on the board with a Tale token of their choice. This token is then put face down once the whole team knows which token it is. The game goes on until all Tale tokens have been played.
Chapter 2, the storytellers, in turn, pick one of the characters of the story and tell what happened implying the token he or she thinks is associated with the character. The game ends once all Tale tokens have been revealed.
In case of failure, the sky darkens because of stormy clouds and in case of success, the sky twinkles with stars.
Cooperate, help each other to amaze the fairytales.

boardgame.name: KILL SCREEN
boardgame.description:
From website:

An odd, large cargo box was delivered with the latest supply run to the station, along with the usual crates of rations, spare parts and magazines. Inside is a bulky, black arcade machine, completely unmarked except for a single word in deep red, blocky lettering on the marquee:

THESEUS

KILL SCREEN is a pamphlet adventure of electronic horror, compatible with the Mothership RPG. Escape the clutches of a sinister arcade machine, fighting or fleeing your way through strange hallucinations, digital nausea and the mind-broken crew of the space station.

In this module you will find:

Terrified, desperate stationers with compromised brains and a variety of unnerving behaviors.
Creeping nightmares and hallucinations.
Rules for playing a malevolent arcade game.
A table for generating more than 1000 different hallucinatory digital monstrosities.
A diagnostic menu for THESEUS, easily portable to Mothership’s Hacker’s Handbook supplement.

boardgame.name: Paperwall
boardgame.description:
The empress gathered the greatest Shoji craftsmen to submit them to a competition for the creation of washi paperwalls. The winner will have the honor of creating the walls for her summer residence.

In summary, "Paperwall" is a game that is played simultaneously.
Each player must play a card to the left or to the right of his row of cards (covering or not the previous card partially).
Each card has 3 strips of wallpaper, at the end of the game, each strip is worth 1 point except for the player with the most (there are 4 different types of strips).

boardgame.name: Space Lane Trader
boardgame.description:
In Space Lane Trader, you are playing a character in control of a cargo ship, trying to make a fortune in the newly opened up shipping trade. You buy and sell goods transporting them between planets within the Terran Federation, preferably to where demand and prices are high. The main objective of the game is to earn money (credits) faster than your competitors and return to show off your success.

During the course of the game, you can fit your ship with upgrades that will make it go faster, attack harder and defend better – all with the goal to ensure that you manage to beat your competitors to the goal. You can also buy new ships with better capabilities, that can carry more goods for you, go faster or fit more upgrades.
Your character will develop during the game – from the inexperienced person starting play at Terra station in the Solar system, to a grizzled space ship captain with much improved skills. You develop your character by spending Experience Points (XP), that are earned by drawing Event cards as the game progresses.

The most obvious way of earning money is buying goods, transporting it to another planet and selling it there. Another way however, is attacking your competitors and take what should have been yours anyway. Winning combat against another player will allow you to either steal cargo from your opponent or take loot in the form of Debris cards. Debris cards can either give you valuable salvage that can be sold on planets, or the best equipment in the game that will improve your ship beyond the capabilities of your competitors.

Not all parts of space are safe. Planets away from the most busy parts of space are characterized by a wild west mentality and the Terran Federation security forces don´t have the capacity to uphold law and order everywhere. This is reflected by two different security levels in the game – green and yellow. Green security level planets are safer, and although bad things can happen, the negative consequences are not so extensive. On security level yellow planets however, the dangers are higher but also the rewards.

boardgame.name: DELVE SRD
DWARF FORGED SRD
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

This is the System Reference Document for DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game by Anna Blackwell.

This document contains the license information for producing and distributing your own DELVE, RISE, and UMBRA content.

Content made using this SRD can be referred to as Dwarf Forged or as unofficial expansions.
boardgame.rpg: DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game
RISE: A Solo Game of Spreading Evil
UMBRA: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers

boardgame.name: Victory Tank
boardgame.description:
The Renault FT, a French light tank, was used by both French and American forces to turn the tide during the final stages of the Great War (World War I). The FT was aptly nicknamed the "Victory Tank" thanks to its essential role during the war effort. The tank was sure to terrify its opponents fighting in the trenches on the Western Front. In Victory Tank, one of these tanks has gone AWOL... Two opposing armies fight on a fog covered battlefield to capture bunkers and retrieve resources while trying to commandeer the tank gone rogue to increase their own military prowess. Which army will be victorious?

In this quick, light, and tactical game, two commanders will try to lead their armies to victory over a couple of rounds divided into two phases. During the "Fog of War" phase the active player will draw two cards to be added to the ever growing battlefield. Each card depicts goals and bonuses to be placed on the battlefield. The active player gets to keep and place one of these cards while offering the other card to its opponent, providing interesting choices and dilemmas to the players during the game.

During the second phase, the "Command" phase, players will take up to five actions each to influence their literal and figurative position in battle. Players will move their soldiers, deploy new units to the battlefield and attack their opponent. Each player has a limited amount of command cards that the player can utilize to boost their actions, fighting power, or defense strength during an attack. And don’t forget that somewhere hidden in the mist, a tank has been abandoned. Finding, operating and fighting with this tank on your side may just bring you victory…

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alien Getaway
boardgame.description:
Poor, ever so clumsy Zoid has committed a big boo-boo, an mistake of astronomic propositions, so to say. Zoid's little accident set off a chain reaction that led to the destruction of an entire uninhabited planet. Luckily, Zoid was able to jump into his spaceship in time to escape the explosion. But to stay ahead of the planet's ravaging debris, he has to carefully navigate the asteroid field that surrounds it. Will you help Zoid get away?

In Alien Getaway 1 to 4 players help Zoid to find his way through the asteroid field. Players will play cards to lay out an escape route for this little green man. However, Zoid is an impatient little bugger and if he travels too fast and gets off track, the active player will have to take a penalty. But, there are ways to get rid of penalties and taking a penalty might not always be as bad as it seems...

Alien Getaway combines tile laying, press-your-luck dice rolling, and tactical set building mechanisms into a swift game that is out of this world!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mole Control
boardgame.description:
It is a nice and breezy summer day. The perfect day to do some gardening. Then a pile of dirt catches your attention. On closer inspection it appears to be a molehill. Panic! Moles may look cute, but they are a menace to your beautiful, flower filled garden. You need to get this mole under control, now!

In this game for 2 to 5, players take turns to add cards with stinky flowers and tasty insects (or so the Mole thinks) to the communal gardens. After that, you get to move the Mole to one of the gardens. The garden occupied by the mole is off-limits until the Mole is moved to another garden.

Once you run out of cards, you must claim one of the gardens. But, make sure to pick a garden the mole doesn't like, or your flowery oasis will soon be nothing but dirt and bumps again...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Erotic Arcana
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:

Have you ever wondered what DnD would be like if it was horny. I mean like actually horny, beyond whatever the bard has been doing. Well I wrote this book specifically to add rules for sex and sexuality into your 5th Edition game. We got it all - stats, monsters, spells, subclasses and more all focused on sex and general horniness.

Do you want to have sex with a dragon? Do you want to seduce a mermaid? Do you want to curse your enemies so that the next time they orgasm they take 1d10 psychic damage? Weird. But Totally possible.

Let's get kinky.

boardgame.name: The Secret Garden of Keukenhof: Spin & Write
boardgame.description:
It is a game in which we pretend to be the gardeners who work in secret to present one of the pavilions of this beautiful garden located in Holland, the game is composed of several leaves that represent the 4 pavilions of this garden, the gardener leaves of each player and 2 boards that will indicate which flowers can be painted, the number of flowers to be painted and the score that certain flowers will give at the end of the game.

At the beginning of a game round, the flower tokens will turn to see which flowers will be available this round, each player will choose one of the available flowers to paint in their color on the garden sheet, each player in their turn will be able to gather resources to play skills that help him or in his case that hinder the opponents, the game will end when the last meeple of the garden sheet is marked, after all the players have played their last turn, the scoring stage begins, that gardener will win (player ) that more points have obtained.
During the game, the decision of where to paint the flowers, the number of flowers, the choice and the final score may vary depending on certain skills that a player can play, which means that the game may differ from game to game.


The player who will start the round is chosen.
Paint the meeple color that starts on the garden leaf.
Turn the flower tiles.
Turn the flower quantity token.
Earn and spend resources to play skills.
Choose the flower that you will paint on the garden sheet.
Paint an X amount of the flower you chose in your color.
End your turn and prepare for the next round.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alfons Åberg Tågspel
boardgame.description:
Follow Alfons Åberg and his friends as they drive trains and pick up various passengers along the way. The one who has first picked up his passengers must get to the station as quickly as possible and win the game.

The tokens at the beginning show which of Alfon's two friends you should pick up on your train. Then everyone drives around and picks up and releases. So you risk driving around looking for a friend who is already sitting in someone else's train.
Each turn, roll the dice. Get your two passangers to the train station first to win the game.

boardgame.name: The Sandwich Game
boardgame.description:
The Sandwich Game is a fun way for family and friends to gather around the game table and compete to see who can eat their way to victory!

Work as a group to build community sandwiches then bid as individuals to see who eats each sandwich. Be the champion by eating the most delicious sandwiches, or just have fun by making your opponent eat road kill and rotten tomatoes between two moldy croissants. But beware, because your opponent might completely change what’s happening by throwing down a special napkin card at the last moment!

The Sandwich game is a card game played in multiple phases. Play starts in the Building Sandwiches phase where players take turns drawing cards and building communal sandwiches.

Once a sandwich is completed play enters the Bidding phase where players take turns placing bid cards face down in front of any player (including themselves). Once all players have finished placing bids, the bid score for each player is calculated to determine who eats the sandwich. Eating the sandwich will reward that player with the point value of the sandwich (determined by the cards that make up the sandwich). Players can interrupt play and sour their opponent's plans by playing Napkin Cards. These cards have specific effects on game play and scoring.

The game end is determined by the number of players playing. For 2 player games, the first player to 25 points wins. In 3-4 player games the first player to 15 points is victorious. For a 5 player game the Ultimate Sandwich Champion is the player with the most points after 5 sandwiches have been eaten.

boardgame.name: Fairies In MECHS
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
TINY WARRIORS.
SLIGHTLY BIGGER MECHS.
Queen Mab is going carousing. You are her bodyguards. As fairy warriors, you are three inches tall, light as the wind, and a fierce fighter. But with all the possible enemies out there hoping to capture or dispatch your queen, you need bigger guns. You need your giant mech suits. With armour plating, magicks, and heavy artillery, these two-foot-tall titans are the perfect weapons to ensure Queen Mab has her night on the town and makes it home in one piece.

ONE PAGE.
This is a one-page game. Everything is included in a single 8.5" x 11" sheet. You can see the whole game in the preview screenshot. Download it for free, tell your friends, pay me if you want, or don't, it's up to you.

ILLUMINATED BY LUMEN.
The world's FIRST, GREATEST, and ONLY* one-page LUMEN game!


This statement is true at the time of publication but may be subject to change pending further developments in the expanding roster of games in the LUMENverse.

boardgame.name: Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion – reDrewno Insert
Gloomhaven: Szczęki Lwa – reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion.

boardgame.name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for retail version of Waste Knights: Second Edition

boardgame.name: CHANGE: A Homeless Survival Experience
boardgame.description:
If you became homeless... what would you do?
CHANGE is an emotional homeless survival experience set in a randomly generated city with rogue-like elements. Explore, survive, earn perks, find items and kindness to develop your character and escape to a new life.
​
This is a hate letter to the growing indifference in the world. When members of the development team almost fell into homelessness some years ago, it inspired us to create something that gives a voice to the forgotten and the vulnerable.

After almost 5 years of research and hard work, 100s of updates and fan support, we bring you our tale of survival and isolation.

FEATURES
​

One of the largest perk systems ever made, with over 130 unique perks gained by experimenting with different methods of survival
Explore an endless city that's different every time you play
Choose from 5 different characters each with their own background stories and maladies, then create your own story
100's of well written "night events" lets you develop your own abstract tale, using a novel system that changes your story depending on how you choose to play
Find companions and find kindness. Build a reputation or even friendships with various characters including the other homeless and the police
Build your inventory with food, survival tools, clothing and more... as well as unlocking new items for your next playthrough as you progress
Spend a night in police stations, parks or shelters, spend time at bars, visit the clinic, study in the library, recycle scrap and more as you discover new areas and buildings
Learn about the lives of the homeless and everything they go through to survive, with every part of the truth having been heavily researched by the developers
Experience a beautifully composed emotional soundtrack



Manage your hunger, hygiene, happiness, crime levels, street reputation, study levels and other stats as you try to survive and escape the homeless life. But you can only do so much in one day... what will you do?

Will you spend the day begging, depending on the kindness of others?

Will you find shelter in the night?

Perhaps you're moved out of the area by the police for loitering. Unable to find shelter, you end up on the streets at night, and you meet a dog. Is it a stray? Could it be a friend? All your actions affect your happiness in some way, and it's up to you to manage your stats accordingly. You could turn to drink, but risk addiction. You could hope for a fortunate event, or make some progress towards your survival.

But you will have to choose. It could all be over if a bad event occurs in the dangerous night streets. Especially during winter.

Every game is different, and with each playthrough comes more ways to explore CHANGE.

If you became homeless... what would you do?

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Space Explorers: Age of Ambition
boardgame.description:
In the Age of Ambition expansion, you discover new frontiers of the Golden Era of Astronautics.

Defend the interests of your Space Power. Enlist the support of influential politicians, powerful military leaders, and renowned scientists. Overcome crises and reach your strategic goals. Launch cutting-edge spacecraft and achieve breakthroughs in research. Manage it all using your own unique talents to carry out the most daring plans.

The glorious history of space exploration unfolds over the 7 separate Modules. You add them to the game in any combination, using up to 3 Modules at a time. Each Module perfectly fits the others and creates new gaming experiences.

boardgame.name: Μαγνητικό Μπάσκετ Τσέπης (Pocket magnetic basket-ball)
boardgame.description: Μαγνητικό Μπάσκετ Τσέπης (Pocket magnetic basket-ball) is a fun 2 player game themed after basketball.

boardgame.name: 18Korea
boardgame.description:
18Korea is a stock investment and railway management game based on the Korean Peninsula. You can set up a railroad company and build your investment portfolio by buying and selling stocks.
It collects dividends and benefits from the increase in the value of its holdings.
Founded railway companies are involved in the construction of tracks and stops, purchase of trains and
Manage operations and the revenues generated from them.

boardgame.name: The Streets of Newark
boardgame.description:
The Streets of Newark is a two to five player game and each player will take on the role of one of the five Dons running Newark during prohibition. The board consists of 9 to 23 location tiles, based upon the number of players, and each player has three lieutenants. The lieutenants each have up to four soldiers in their crew, and the lieutenant's crew moves around the various locations of the board as a unit. Soldiers can be improved through equipment cards.

Each turn, players secretly determine where they will deploy their lieutenant's crews. Then everyone reveals simultaneously and moves their crews to the selected locations. While at the locations, crews complete jobs, actively corrupt policemen and officials, or collect protection money. But If two or more player's move crews to the same location, there can be conflict, and even bloodshed.

Play continue until one Don achieves one of the five victory conditions. The five different win conditions are (1) becoming the next crime lord through reputation, (2) controlling the city's locations, (3) corrupting the city's officials and police force, (4) conquering the other mob's forces through bloodshed or (5) conspiring with the federal investigators. No player is pigeon-holed into any one victory path, but each Don's lieutenants have unique abilities.

The Streets of Newark was designed to have great replay value, with tremendous depth and strategy. There are countless combinations of board configurations, decisions, soldiers, upgrades and paths to victory.

boardgame.name: PMC 2670
boardgame.description:
PMC 2670 is hard sci-fi platoon-sized ruleset intended for 15mm and it's second edition of PMC 2640 released in 2013.

Introduction
In 2013, we have boldly released PMC 2640, which successfully found its place on crowded 15mm sci-fi wargames market. Now, it's high time to leap forward! In the last 3 years, we have worked hard on PMC 2670, which is much more than just a new edition of the game! As you can probably guess, the action takes place 30 years later in the same dirty, gloomy PMC-verse – but it's also indirectly connected to Shadows in the Void, which takes place much later in the same timeline. The story was moved forward: humanity developed new technologies and improved older ones, encountered an alien threat (or rather the aliens encountered a human threat...) and made the galaxy an even more turbulent place.

So, what are the gameplay changes?
There is no revolution in the core mechanics, as better is often the enemy of good... Still, the basic rules were polished and perfected, making the game even faster, more flexible and more uncompromising – but it's still the old, fine PMC! Special rules were revisited and all known question-causing or unclear elements were re-edited. But the main advantage of the 2670 edition are the added extras! Now you can lead not only merc forces, but also space bugs and rebels, which became fully playable factions. What is more, there is a fourth faction – the aforementioned aliens! Forces of your PMCs were bolstered with lots of additional unit entries, offering many new tactics and army compositions. We listened to the players and added a lot of elements they asked for (e.g. power armours, medics, drop pods, and many exotic sci-fi troops). Existing units were carefully examined and rebalanced to adjust them to the new lists. But don't worry, if you already have a collection of minis for PMC 2640, it will be fully playable in PMC 2670 – you'll simply get even more possibilities! We see no point in making existing armies useless or weaker – we're players ourselves and know how irritating this can be! In addition to new armies and PMC units, we have updated the scenarios based on the experience from previous years – but no major changes in this chapter.

Anything else?
Of course! All factions received their own campaign rules, allowing for even more interesting club gaming! Campaign is as important, as it was aspect of the ruleset. Whether you wish to create your own PMC, start a revolt, make bugs the dominant species on the planet or conquer new territories for your Xenotripod tribe, you will have the means to do it. Campaigns became even more challenging thanks to improvements such as quicker progress at the beginning and reduced snowball effect.

...and?
The whole solitaire/coop section was redone. Thanks to universal scenarios you can use any force against any other force on any tier. Additionally, the Special Commando composition allows you to start playing with just a few finished minis – perfect for people who like to collect different armies without expanding them too much.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.

boardgame.name: Picking Up the Pieces
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Picking Up the Pieces is a two-player roleplay game about exploring a broken relationship and deciding, after all is said and done, if you want to fix it.

Picking up the Pieces will allow you to explore a broken relationship with a friend. You and your partner will be given the tools and the opportunity to work through your issues, past and present. When all is said and done you may wish to work toward a relationship renewed. You may part ways, never to speak again.

This game is meant to be a tense, often times uncomfortable and unforgiving conversation between two people who hurt each other. Play with someone you trust implicitly.

Content & Trigger Warning
While you and your partner have total control over the content introduced in Picking Up the Pieces, the game may lead to

+ potential loss of a loved one

+ potential mentions of abuse, both emotional and physical

+ tension, arguments & hard conversations

boardgame.name: Dice Darts
boardgame.description:
This is a quick and easy luck & push-your-luck game where you try to reach 0 as quickly as possible!

Both start with 121 points.

You take turns in rolling a single dice. Before making a roll you must choose whether to roll d4, d6, d8, d10 (ones), d12, d20, or, d10 (tens). After rolling you deduct your roll from your total points unless your new total would be negative.

You continue back and forth until one person hits exactly 0 points remaining.

With the multifunctional dUltimate dice designed for this game you will always see what "could have been".

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sushi Boat
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Sushi Boat! We are proud to offer you the finest delicacies, hand-crafted by our master sushi chef. Are you new to conveyor belt sushi? You’ll love it! Our chef creates masterpieces and places them on the belt, which brings the sushi right to you.

Just grab whatever looks good as it passes you by and enjoy! Our staff is also on hand to help you if you need it. So take a seat—it’s all you can eat!

Each turn, players perform their choice of actions, including taking plates of sushi off the revolving 'belt' on the board, paying staff tiles for effects, buying side dishes and more.

As you eat, you’ll stack your Plates in front of you. You score points by eating off matching Plates, and for eating a wide variety of sushi types. And you’ll need to pay attention all the time, because you never know when someone will start a Wasabi Challenge!

When the side dish deck runs out, the game ends and players calculate their victory points - highest score wins!

boardgame.name: Biome: Borneo
boardgame.description:
Discover the Bornean rainforest.

Form micro-habitats using plant tiles, and attract animals to build food-chains, as you compete for resources and space.

Take advantage of opportunities but be ready to quickly adapt to new strategies; as the jungle is transformed into a thriving Biome.

On their turn a player is allowed up to two actions: Exchange cards; Exchange Tiles; Play a card and place tiles onto the board. Special Ability cards may also be played according to their specific rules, and can grant a player a strategic advantages when used.

There are also Disaster cards in the form of Forest Fires and Poachers that will add difficulty and randomness to the game. Players will determine during set-up the level of chaos and disruptions they would like to potentially encounter during a game, which test all player's abilities to adapt when drawn.

The game ends when the final tile is picked up by a player, triggering a final action for every player.

Points determine the winner and are attained by earning cards through tile placement.

boardgame.name: Lava
boardgame.description:
Lava is a territorial stacking game for two players, Red and Black. Play using a Hexhex board size 4 or 5, and a sufficient supply of Red/Black stacking checkers. To setup, place one Red and one Black checker in opposite corners of the hex hex board.

On each turn, take N checkers (where N is any number from 1 to stack size) from the top of a stack you control and move them N spaces in a straight line to a destination containing N or less checkers. Then, add a new checker of your color to the destination. Stacks may not jump over enemies, but may land on enemy or friendly stacks, thereby burying them.

When the board is full, the player controlling more stacks wins the game.

Lava was designed by Michael Amundsen and Alek Erickson in August 2021.

boardgame.name: Defense Grid: Borderlands
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Defense Grid: Borderlands is a free DLC for Defense Grid: The Awakening that includes 4 new levels: Onslaught, Forge, Entanglement, Infiltration.

boardgame.name: Secrets of Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Discover the untold potential of magic! Secrets of Magic, the newest hardcover rulebook for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! Secrets of Magic brings the popular magus and summoner classes into Pathfinder Second Edition, unlocking heroes who combine magical might with martial prowess and offering command of a powerful magical companion creature. The lavishly illustrated, 256-page rulebook contains hundreds of new spells with potent offerings for all spellcasting character classes, magic items for any player character, and lore detailing the fundamental structure and theories of magic. A special section within the volume—the Book of Unlimited Magic—presents new methods of spellcasting, with elementalism, geomancy, shadow magic, rune magic, and even pervasive magic to give every place and creature in your game a magical spin!

boardgame.name: Spoken on the Song Wind
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Trouble in the Academy! The heroes have proven themselves to be worthy additions to Magaambya school of magic, but they are still students. Trusted to handle important school business in the surrounding city of Nantambu, the Song-Wind City, the heroes confront a vengeful alchemist, stealthy infiltrators, and other dangers. A mysterious artifact housed within the Magaambya might be the source of the school's recent troubles, but can the students discover its secrets, protect their fellow students, and still graduate?

boardgame.name: Neon
boardgame.description:
Neon is a 2-player game about speed and memory. Can you put the cards of the same number together to gain the bonus under time pressure?

Shuffle and split the deck of 54 cards between the players. Each player lays down a 3x3 grid with the center card faceup. Both players act simultaneously to reveal one card from their deck at a time and use it to replace any one card in their grid. Keep replacing cards (and of course memorizing their numbers) until their deck runs out.

Victory points are rewarded in 3 ways:

Be the first to run out of their deck.
Have a lower sum of their 9 cards in the grid.*
Win more "battles" against the opponent in the 3 columns.


The fun part of Neon is, if you can place cards of the same number next to each other (the more the merrier), you will gain a bonus that reduces your sum!
Play multiple rounds until someone earns 5 VP and wins!

boardgame.name: Villagesong
boardgame.description:
From the publisher homepage
Villagesong is a fantastical RPG about communities, leadership, and change, inspired by tales from ancient Java. Your decisions will determine the future of your village and the island. What will you sacrifice, and what will you hold dear?

You play a village leader, responsible for your home. As the game progresses, draw cards from the change deck to discover the events facing your village. You will make tough decisions, form and break bonds with other leaders, and discover how your island changes. Choice by choice, you will shape the song of your village, sung for many years to come.

From the back of the tuckbox

Lead your Village, shape the island.

Tell a tempestous story of leadership and change on an island rife with trials, spirits and unrest. Play a village leader, facing hard decisions in the struggle for your island's future. Choice by choice, shape the song of your village, sung for many years to come.


Easy to learn, start playing in minutes
Play with friends or enjoy solo mode
Everything you need in this box


Game contents: 6 leaders, 6 villages, 5 bonds, 42 change cards, 4 references, 1 turn token, 1 rules booklet

1-4 Players - 2-4 hours - Age 14 & up

boardgame.name: Lasse-Maja pusseldeckarspelet
boardgame.description: In the Puzzle Detective game, you must solve crimes by jigsawing different clues. When you get to a crime scene, you have to pull a puzzle piece with stolen goods from the bag. This is your first clue. You put the stolen goods in front of you and hurry on to the next crime scene. You can find the thief in the line of suspects by dragging event cards on your way between the various crime scenes. When you find the thief, you puzzle the thief together with the stolen goods. You need a thief and at least two stolen items of the same color to finish the game. For now, you should quickly get to the right crime scene and get the last clue to complete your investigation. The one who first has a complete chain of evidence of puzzle pieces in front of him; a thief + at least two stolen goods + a crime scene in the same suit are the winners of the game!

boardgame.name: Tabannusi: Builders of Ur – Tantrum House Promo
boardgame.description:
This promo adds 3 Ship tiles and 1 Harbormaster tile

1x Size "1" ship, brown
When you place a Water tile onto a space with a printed bonus, receive that bonus (once per turn).

1x Size "1" ship, white
Whenever you Construct a Building, you may (only once) pay any 1 green Resource to place 1 Water tile and 1 Garden tile (both in the same space).

1x Size "1" ship, yellow
Whenever you Construct a Building, you may pay 1 Gold to immediately score the Building (ignoring any surrounding Gardens).

Harbormaster tile
Move up once on each Mastery track.

boardgame.name: Our Mundane Supernatural Life (Littlebox version)
boardgame.description:
Blurb from the publisher website

A cozy game of extraordinary daily living.

Our Mundane Supernatural Life is a cozy two player RPG that explores the everyday life of a supernatural person and their loved one. It’s a game about the difficulties of going grocery shopping when you’re partly ethereal, or the importance of finding good child care every full moon.

In this game, you play through a single day of your life together. But life always comes with its problems. Face supernatural and mundane troubles as your day unfolds.

From the back of the tuckbox

An extraordinary day awaits you!

Explore the everyday life of a supernatural person and their loved one. Plan your day together, then face magical and mundane troubles as activities unfold. Find out more about yourselves and each other, and enjoy your unusual day.


Easy to learn, start playing in minutes
Everything you need in this box
Tell a tender story with heart


Game contents: 2 character cards, 2 time tokens, 18 schedule cards, 2 markers, 1 four-sided die, 1 rules booklet + bonus expansion: 3 day cards

2 players - 60-90 minutes - Age 14 & up

boardgame.name: The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers
boardgame.description:
Take a journey back in time - or is it forward in time? - to relive the formative years of Gallamut Zeers. Gallamut Zeers, now filled with industry and frowns, was once a land filled with lush vegetation and wonderful beasts. The Lords of Gallamut Zeers settled on this fertile island long ago, but quickly decided they could not share it with each other, because they were grumpy and itchy. Their moustaches tickled their noses something fierce and their socks were made of wool, which is scratchy, you know! So they quarreled and debated and demanded, as all those who feel entitled do, until they concluded who would own and rule the various parts of the fruitful island. Here, and there, and everywhere they bickered! Silly Lords, there’s plenty of space to go around!

In The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers, players take on the roles of Lords of Gallamut Zeers struggling to gain dominion over the island. Over three years, players will claim roads, occupy cities, set up encampments, and make diplomacy in an attempt to outwit their opponents. The player who employs the most clever tactics and the most efficient strategy to accumulate the most points will win the game!

The Formative Years of Gallamut Zeers is a tactical area-control/majority game which is played over 3 rounds. Each round, players will play four of six available action cards to place and manipulate cubes to score points. Between the rounds, players will take part in a simultaneous secret action selection to take a bonus action or block other players from taking an action. At the end of each round, there are eight categories in which players may score points.

boardgame.name: Spooky Bonus
boardgame.description:
Uncover dark forces emanating from the heart of Old Town, and grab spooky accessories for your front yard makeover, too! You'll be spellbound by this adorably ghoulish horror-themed puzzle game.

Match shapes to stamp out evil and advance through Old Town, gathering gold and powerups as you go. Shop for yard decorations that boost your gameplay. Unleash exploding pumpkins, silver crosses, holy water, and more.

The time has come to unlock the sinister secret of Spooky Bonus. A blood curdling adventure awaits you!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Resource Bags (3-Pack)
Seize the Bean: Resource Sacks (3-Pack)
boardgame.description: A set of 3 cloth resource bags with drawstrings and button clasps. The bags will be useful not only for storing the components when not playing, but also for quick setup during play. The bean bag will be faux burlap, the milk bag will be linen, and the sugar bag will be faux velvet.

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Resin First Player Tokens
boardgame.description: This add-on is for a set of 2 figures, one representing the First Player (as a full cup of coffee) and the other representing the Next First Player (as an empty cup of coffee). These will be over-sized resin figures so that they stand out on the table.

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Cubee Meeples
boardgame.description: This add-on is for a set of 8, Cubee-shaped meeples.

boardgame.name: A Shadow In The Valley
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Brindlewood Bay Mystery for the Random Adventure Jam by Chris Bissette.

When the Mavens are invited to a meet Lord and Lady Grimsvale to discuss "a grave and concerning situation" it seems like the start of an usual adventure. But when they arrive, there is no-one is to be found...

Where could everybody have gone? How can there be no signs of what might have happened?

In a tale of shadows and loneliness, I only hope you will find the answers you seek.

boardgame.name: WRONG GOD
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A location for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Bernpyle #6 "Into the Veins" (August 2021)
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Bernpyle #6: Into the Veins is an unofficial Mausritter zine and it is packed full of fun content. This zine is a tribute to Patrick Stuart's Veins of the Earth. Bernpyle #6 features new rules for subterranean exploration, rules for tracking resources and a new character sheet. It also provides a real life subterranean bestiary of some scary creatures. There are also four new spells and some new Hollow Knight inspired items. Enjoy the brutal excursion Into the Veins of the Earth

boardgame.name: Esotera, the Awakening
boardgame.description:
Esotera, the Awakening, is a new entry into the world of TCG that takes the complexities of most card games and reduces them to 10 game modifiers, 4 card values, and 1 card archetype value. The entire game involves a deck of 40 cards, hands of 5 matches consisting of 3 - 5 rounds with 5 turns for each player. With this seeming simplicity is a very low barrier to entry for new players, but a lot of complexity, strategy, and deck building for dedicated players to maximize the win: loss of the game mechanics!

Aside from the game aspect of Esotera, it is also a cultural doorway to many religions, societies, fantasy, science fiction, and even Alien Conspiracy theory that unites all of these things into an easy to digest medium that will push the imagination and interest of the player. Finally the post Kickstarter goals of the project will be to establish a non-profit debt forgiveness program that collects Student loan and medical debts and forgives them unconditionally as a way of giving back to the greater community during these unprecedented times!

boardgame.name: Jesús de Nazaret Rex Pacis
boardgame.description:
Jerusalem, year 33 of our era. A man is about to die, he wants to celebrate his Last Supper... and you are invited.

Join the group of the chosen ones and get the apostles on your side. Send followers, make profits, get parables, place yourself in the best positions, decide who you favour before the Sanhedrin ends Jesus' life. Will you be the first to sit next to him at the table?

The game is a medium Eurogame designed to be played by 2 to 4 players. The main objective is, playing one card per turn, to have the largest number of followers at the table of the Last Supper; and not only that, but also to place them as close as possible to the apostles and Jesus himself, as proximity is what will provide the most victory points at the end of the game.

Beware of Judas, who is always lurking...

boardgame.name: Checkmate
boardgame.description:
A puzzly game about keeping things in check, mate.

Cards represents Chess pieces, and have black and white on each side. They are setup in a 3x3 grid with Kings in opposing corners.

The goal is to end each turn by making a move that puts the opposing King in check. If you cannot do this, you lose the game.

Players will alternate turns, doing the following in order:

Choose a card and swap it with another card, according to standard Chess rules.
Flip over either of those cards.
Move your token on top of the card that is putting the opposing King in check. You cannot use a card covered with a token.


For check, you are not playing as Black or White. On the end of your turn, you are playing the most prominent color on your side of the grid, and you must have the opposing color King in check.

The game ends when a player cannot claim check. They lose.

boardgame.name: Cowboy Bebop: Space Serenade – Happy Valentine Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo card released for Valentine's Day.

Rule: Each other player reveals a non-base card from their hand.
Choose one and put it in your hand.
It's owner draws the first card of the common deck.

boardgame.name: Two Hundred Ways
boardgame.description:
Two Hundred Ways, the sequel of the successful brain teaser One Hundred Ways, gives puzzle fans twice as many mental challenges to overcome. The mission of each of its 200 levels sounds easy: guide one or more balls to the exit. But levels with up to three different layers and numerous ball traps don't make this task a walk in the park. Luckily, players can use dozens of tools to help them reach their goal - but using more tools means that their level score will go down...

FEATURES:


200 levels that will keep players busy for a long time
40+ tools that make it easier to guide each ball - or more difficult...
Up to three balls per level
Up to three layers per level
Real-time 3D isometric view
Players can zoom in/out of levels and rotate them for better strategizing
Gradually increasing difficulty
Tutorial level for each tool
Two level themes, each with its own soundtrack
Game languages: English and German


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Trzecie Powstanie
boardgame.description:
In the night of the second to the third of May 1921 began the third Silesia uprising.

Silesia after the end of World War 1 was to be partitioned between Germany and the restored Polish state. The Poles however were not satisfied with the suggested partition, which would result in keeping by the Germans of a huge area which was primarily ethnically Polish.

The game released by Pospolite Ruszenie Szlachty Ziemi Krakowskiej is primarily an educational tool, designed to commemorate the 100'th anniversary of this successful Polish uprising.

It is a game for 2 players using two separate decks of cards and a board, depicting the area, where the fighting took place.

boardgame.name: Adios
boardgame.description:
Adios is a cinematic first-person game about sticking to a complicated decision.

You're a pig farmer in Kansas. It's October. Cold, crisp mornings are the norm, and you have decided that you're no longer okay with letting the mob use your pigs to dispose of bodies. When your old friend - a hitman - arrives with his assistant to deliver another body, you finally screw up the courage to tell them that you're done.

Your friend doesn't want you to stop. He knows that there's no such thing as quitting, so he'll try to convince you that you're making a mistake. You spend the day together, doing chores and exploring the nooks and crannies of an authentic environment in the American Midwest alongside the man who will be forced to kill you, if he can't convince you to stay.

How you respond will determine the rest of your life.

Adios means goodbye.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One/ Series X downloadable edition

boardgame.name: City Streets: A Thrilling Strategy Racing Game
boardgame.description:
An escalating roll and move racing game where players strategically purchase and use upgrades and items in an effort to be the first to finish 10 laps.

Each player begins with $4000 and some free items of their choice. Players roll dice and move their cars around the board, then interact with the spaces they land on. Players can accumulate items purchased from shops which allow them to move further on each turn, use boosters, sabotage opponents, take shortcuts, earn extra money, and more. Players interact with other spaces they land on to move further, take a shortcut, earn extra money, or to gain or lose a turn. Players earn more money upon completion of each lap.

Different items the players purchase offer different strategies. Players can focus on upgrading speed, purchasing items that give options, taking shortcuts, or investing in money gaining items early so they can buy everything and make a blazing comeback. The first player to finish the 10th lap wins the game.

boardgame.name: AI War 2: Zenith Onslaught
boardgame.description:
Expansion for the base game.

User Summary

boardgame.name: AI War 2: The Spire Rises
boardgame.description:
First expansion which adds two new factions, new mechanics and other content.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Wandering Merchants
boardgame.description:
From the description:

9 Soulsborne-inspired system-neutral merchant NPCs.

boardgame.name: Ankora: Lost Days
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Adventure.User Summary

boardgame.name: Anthropomachy
boardgame.description:
Get ready for conquering the world as a God! But don’t think it’s going to be that easy. Humans have evolved in many aspects since the mythological times, so be wise while using your divine abilities!

Show compassion to those who have nothing and they will love you. Take from those who have all and they will fear you. Watch out for events happening around the globe and avoid skepticism. Make humanity praise you!


True-to-life scenario: 71 distinct territories with stats modeled after their real-life counterparts, including other religious presences;
Twelve major and nine minor gods: From the very famous to the most uncommon Greek myths;
Real-time events: Take advantage of them and gain bonuses or fail and watch skepticism rise;
More than 250 divine abilities: all of them based on actual mythological tales about its God;
Use your blessings or curses to gain Faith: Spend it to buy more abilities, develop traits to gain bonuses and even recruit a minor god that might be able to affect attributes you can’t.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tippi Tree
boardgame.description:
Tippi Tree is a brand new original game designed specifically for 3D printing. Take turns placing Leaves on top of your Tippi Tree, but don't let it topple! The aim of the game is simple, but you'll find that every round can offer new challenges and surprises.

This stacking game features a unique S-shaped Leaf piece that connects to other Leaves in over 60 unique ways, so every Tippi Tree grows differently. That makes this game fun and challenging for anyone from age 6 to 106.

On a player's turn, they will use one hand to add a leaf to the tree while trying not to topple the tree or knock off any leaves.

If. during your turn. you knock off any leaves then your turn is over and the leaf you are holding and any leaves you knocked off go to your stockpile. The first player to empty their stockpile of leaves is the winner. However, if you knock over the entire tree then you lose the game.

Great for parties, family nights, desk distractions, and a fantastic gift! Easy to print & play, but difficult to master.

boardgame.name: Intellectual Property in RPGs
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This guide covers the very basics of the USA's intellectual property law, as applied to roleplaying games. The guide covers copyrights, trademarks, patents, and how they apply in the RPG world. The guide then goes over a few types of pre-existing material that creators can leverage in their own creations without incurring legal liability, such as stock characters and publicly-licensed content.

boardgame.name: Treasure 'N Mutiny!
boardgame.description:
Treasure 'N Mutiny is a Pirate themed Sandbox-Style Roll & Play Adventure Game for 1-12 Players!

Roll Dice To Move, Pick up cards/tokens, use cards/tokens, move on board, attack other players, attack other ships, battle raid (card) events
Game Ends when ONE player or team completes the END GAME SCENARIO

boardgame.name: Tic Tac K.O.: Dragons vs Unicorns
Tic Tac K.O.: Szárnyak vs Szarvak
boardgame.description:
Tic Tac K.O. is a quick-to-learn card game that puts a diabolical twist on Tic Tac Toe, letting you smack your opponents to the side as you claim squares in your quest for victory. These adorably ruthless Dragons and Unicorns won't hesitate to destroy their opponents with fire, lightning, or a swift kick in the patoot.

In Tic Tac K.O., two teams battle for control of the Grid by playing Character and Magic cards featuring diabolical Dragons and unforgiving Unicorns. Players lay down cards one at a time on the tic-tac-toe grid to match the pattern on their Objective Cards.

The first team to complete 3 Objectives wins the game!

Pre-orders before 9/8/2021 received an exclusive holographic Team Unicorn card.
