boardgame.name: Tulip Bubble: Update Kit
boardgame.description:
When the Japanese third edition of Tulip Bubble was released in 2017, an Update Kit was also released for owners of the Japanese first & second editions to catch up with the third edition's changes.

This kit included the third-edition rulebook, the redesigned starting player marker (was resin, now laser-cut wood), redesigned buying marker tokens (now square to better differentiate them from the round coin tokens), and update stickers for some of the cards and the board.

The rules were updated to keep gameplay moving more efficiently, and the difficulty of purchasing black tulips increased a little.

boardgame.name: Tulip Bubble: Drawstring Bag
boardgame.description: A drawstring bag made of soft fabric, decorated with tulip artwork, to store Tulip Bubble game pieces in. It measures 11cm x 15cm (4.3in x 5.9in). A matching microfiber cloth handkerchief was also offered alongside the bag.

boardgame.name: GIST!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

This is a very freeform and streamlined RPG ruleset, inspired by the Free Kriegsspiel Revolution and Old School Renaissance movements, based on the most famous old school sci-fi RPG, but intended to be used in any setting or genre. The system is designed to be very flexible and hackable. Hacks are indeed encouraged and welcomed.

boardgame.name: Happy Planets
boardgame.description:
Happy Planets is a space-themed 24 cards game where the planet's satisfaction will prove to be essential.

You are the new system manager of our company. It is time to prove yourself. Distribute your planets as best as you can in order to create a solid trade route among them, carrying out monthly objectives. The more needs are met, the happier they will be.
Remember: A planet that pays its toll is a happy planet!

You can play alone or with friends, all players work to (or help each other) build a new commercial empire from scratch. Using 24 cards, 1 core objective (Happiness) and a variable secondary objectives system (3 per game). Happy Planets changes every time you play it!

Each turn, players will take 1 card (when the game starts, they take 2) from the deck and play one of them in the galactic system. Every planet that is put on game increases the Happiness of the surrounding ones while increasing its own. This will depend on each planet's needs and production.

While in cooperative mode, players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to grow their planets' happiness in the most efficient way, but taking on account the secondary objectives. Planets with a happiness level below minimum will score negative points, so be careful.

In semi-cooperative mode, every player has their own personal objective, which everyone can see.

In competitive mode, secondary objectives are applied to all players, but every player has their own galactic system!

The game ends when all cards have been placed. Players will then see if they have reached the objective scores for the current game.

boardgame.name: Bunny Brawl
boardgame.description:
Bunny Brawl is a card game where players compete to create their own Kill Squad.

Players draw and play cards to summon a bunny or play a card that will slow down his opponent.

The game ends by someone winning when a player completes their Kill Squad this means having 4 Bunnies of 4 Different colors makes you the winner of the game and the game ends.

boardgame.name: Midwinter Celebrations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a holiday module? This is a mash of A Christmas Carol, Home Alone and Die Hard, all with the overhanging theme of Scandinavian folklore.

While preparing for Midwinter Celebrations, something does not feel completely right.

Welcome to the mythical world of Icewind Dale’s folklore.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier Two Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Play Order
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an overview of the DC-PoA-CONMAR-adventures.

All the adventures are playable as standalone adventures. At the same time, it is possible to connect them, and this file is made to support that.

boardgame.name: SIDEQUEST (Issue 1 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Issue 1 contains:


The Ashk Gazetteer: In Ashk, the towns and city-states are safe, but the Sea of Sand is a vast, hostile, wilderness. In this first installment you'll be given an introduction to this new desert-based campaign setting compatible with any fantasy system.



The Ranger of the Wild: A complete rebuild of the base Ranger class for 5e. This rebuild looks to ring the class closer to the classic depictions of the ranger as a skilled warrior living on the fringe protecting civilization from wilderness. Includes full levels 1-20 rules and 3 subclasses.



Save Your Campaign: An article on how to stop the slow death of your campaign and make sure you and your friends keep playing week after week, year after year.



The Sleeper of Uquorah: A new CR11 aberration that hunts in the Astral Sea.


Included in your download is the high quality 300dpi magazine, as well as a smaller file size version. You'll also get the map of Ashk, and a variety of resources for the Sleeper of Uqorah including monster card and VTT token.

boardgame.name: SIDEQUEST (Issue 2 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Issue 2 contains:


The Ashk Gazetteer, The Lords of the Cosmos: A complete pantheon of 20+ deities to use in your games, along with a cosmos map and details of 16 outer planes.



The Time Domain Cleric: Wield the power of Chronomancy with this cleric domain. Allow you allies to rewind time to reroll attacks and checks, infuse your attacks with chonomancy and age your targets, and steal from your fututre self to improve your rolls.



True Name Mechanics: The concept of creatures having a true name which, if spoken, grants the speaker power over them is a classic fantasy trope. These rules add mechanics for this process in 5th edition.



The Tomb of the Jade Tyrant: A short advnture for 4-6 characters of 1st level that sees the players exploring the tomb og the Jade Tyrant. But the players aren't the first adventurers to arrive. . .


Included in your download is the high quality 300dpi magazine, as well as a smaller file size version. You'll also get the map from the adventure in 300 and 75 pixel resolution for VTT play.

boardgame.name: SIDEQUEST (Issue 3 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Issue 3 contains:


The Ashk Gazetteer, Kadim the City of Mages: A magical city complete with a map, 20+ locations, dozens of plot hooks, and information on 70+ NPCs.



Expanded Conditions: Set your enemies on fire or chill them to their core with these new 11 new conditions for 5e combat.



Power Word Spells: 14 new power word spells to rip your enemies limb from limb or cause them to forget prepared spells.



Void Screamer: A CR 13 aberration that tears its way into the material plane from a nightmare realm hunting sources offf strong magics.


Included in your download is the high quality 300dpi magazine, as well as a smaller file size version. You'll also get the map of the city and tokens of the Void Screamer for VTT play.

boardgame.name: SIDEQUEST (Issue 4 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Issue 4 contains:

1. The Ashk Gazetteer In this issue I talk about the apocalypse in Ashk (which my players recently caused) and how the sea of sand has been cursed and is now plagued by terrible corrupted beasts.

This article also includes some advice on what themes and topics to explore in a game set during an apocalypse.

2. Monster Templates
Easily adjust the stats of your monsters with these 11 new monster templates that allow you to quickly change the stats and CR of a monster.

Do you want your mobs to feel more substantial against tht higher level party? Throw the Elite Warrior template on them. Do you need a caster for an encounter but can't find one in the CR range or that fits the theme of your encounter? Choose one of the four Spellcaster templates to give your monsters some magic.

3. Two Chest Mimic
Players love downtime activities, and this issues gives you options for two of the most popular past times for adventurers, gambling and drinking.

Two chest mimic is a new dynamic dice game that keeps players on their toes throughout they try and escape with the treasure without falling victim to the mimics.

4. Drinking Contest Rules
This simple system allows your PCs to take part in drinking contests, get drunk, and feel a variety of effects as a result.

It also includes a drinks menu with pricing and tasting notes for 18 beverages.

Included in your download is the high quality 300dpi magazine, as well as a smaller file size version.

boardgame.name: SIDEQUEST (Issue 5 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What's in issue 5?

The Carnival of Hysteria
The Carnival of Hysteria is a magical circus that moves from town to town bringing thrills and frights to the nearby populace.

In this gazetteer you'll learn about the people and attractions of the carnival.

What's more, there's a election of simple carnival games written by Todd Kleinpaste to entertain your players during their visit!

Vinder's Vault
Any good carnival has great venders, and this issue sees the debut appearance of Vinder's Vault, an interdimensional magic store operated by the mysterious Vinder, a man who always seems to have exactly what you're looking for.

This installment includes several magic items conceived by Zavier Bates, and we will be seeing more of Vinder and his store in future issues!

Bard College of Clowns
This issue includes 4! carnival themed subclasses, with the College of Clowns bard leading the way.

This subclass is focused on mischief and will allow your bard to expand their bardic performances to include pie in the face, acid filled flowers, and more!

The Juggler Fighter
Next up is the juggler fighter, which is the ideal thrown weapon class.

As you level up this class you gain the ability to magically recall your thrown weapons, as well as gain limited flight by hanging onto the thrown weapons.

The Path of Greatness Barbarian
This is the Greatest Show!

The path of Greatness Barbarian is all about putting on a show, and you do that by declaring an Act of Greatness, a great feat that you intend to complete while you rage. Completing these tasks grants you greatness dice that you can use to improve your future rolls.

The Deckmaster Warlock
The Deckcaster is my personal favourite of the subclasses. This warlock subclass is based around the tarot deck, with their patron manifesting its powers through a deck of magical cards know as the fate deck.

Each day the deckmaster draws a random hand of tarot cards which grant them new spells, special abilities, or penalties.

There re 44 unique possibilities in the fate deck, and each is based in part on various interpretations of actual tarot readings.

The Flourish System
Last, but certainly not least, Eric Law brings us a new narrative combat system that allows characters to add a flourish to their attacks when they roll an 18-20.

Blind your opponents, push them down, disarm them, or go for the tendons with this alternate mechanic to make martial combat more interesting and engaging.

boardgame.name: Caves of Kabash
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A macro-designed cave system connected to a cursed remains of a fledgling village residing within a day's journey to the coastal city of Jarios, while the only mountain pass in the area is being attacked by kobolds. Just another day for our adventurers.

Welcome to the City of Jarios in the region of Rios. Connected to the Sea of Artharon, the region of Braemyr lies to the north while across the mountains is the city of Tursen. The trade road to the south leads to Kettleim and an island in the sea is home to no one.

This city is home to five noteworthy inns, multiple guilds, almost a dozen religious groups and one persnickety dwarf whom runs the 'Anvilriver Library of Magical Studies'. The regional city became the supply point in a long forgotten war and is now the primary connection point between the western lands and the ocean going vessels whom request their cargo.

Arrive by trade road or ship. Explore the swamps or traverse the mountains. Bandits on the trade roads roam free, while the rumors of an abandoned dwarven fortress circulate among the inn patrons. Just avoid the caves at all cost. Of those that enter, few return.

Build a one-shot or use this as a framework to build your own city. Leverage the named locations for more insidious plots for your players. If you know your game system and want a framework to connect modules together, then welcome to 'The Caves of Kabash'.

boardgame.name: Edge of the Abyss
boardgame.description:
An adventure for 4-6 PCs of 6th level

Publisher's blurb:

Warlock Lair 63: Edge of the Abyss is intended as a sequel to Warlock Lair 54: Legend of Beacon Rock but can easily stand on its own. People have been disappearing in the region. Entire households along the coast are found empty. Ships traveling west of Beacon Rock sometimes report mysterious bluish-green lights in the deep.

boardgame.name: Akumajō Special: Boku Dracula-kun
boardgame.description: The self-proclaimed Demon King, Kid Dracula, has awoken from a long sleep, only to discover that the demon Galamoth has challenged him. Swiping his father's cape, it is up to Kid Dracula to set out on an adventure to destroy the monster, and retake his throne. After battling through dangers and demons, Kid Dracula defeats Galamoth. This causes him to become famous throughout the land, with all the monsters in Transylvania showing up at his castle wanting to be his friend.

boardgame.name: Castlevania: Order of Shadows
boardgame.description: Order of Shadows is a platform game with RPG characteristics, with gameplay similar to that of Castlevania: Symphony of the Night and other games in the series. The player character is Desmond Belmont, the latest in the line of Belmont family members to star in a Castlevania game. Like other members of the family, he wields a whip as his main weapon which is supplemented with additional sub weapons like throwing axes and vials of holy water that act as firebombs.

boardgame.name: Castlevania: The Arcade
boardgame.description: The gameplay is similar to light gun shooters such as The House of the Dead.

boardgame.name: Цар на Историята: Бонус тесте (King of History: Bonus Deck)
boardgame.description:
Additional deck that adds 45 cards with events from Bulgarian history and 4 bonus cards, giving players that puts even more challenges on the way to the crown of the tsar.


Тестето съдържа 45 карти със събития от българската история, както и 4 бонус карти.

Закупувайки продукта, играчите си осигуряват по-вълнуваща игра, в която пътят към царската корона се изпълва с още предизвикателства.

boardgame.name: The Vanishing Gambler
boardgame.description:
Can you the track down the missing casino cheat who vanished from his Las Vegas jail cell?

Locate the whereabouts of casino cheat Roy Marshall. Discover hidden messages, hack into Roy’s bank account and even go undercover yourself.

Similar to an escape room game, this mystery presents you with an evidence packet sealed with a metal combination lock, and leaves you to work out how to open it and find and solve the mystery.

boardgame.description:

The ghost pepper is the tormented soul of a discarded and unused pepper that possesses mortals and causes them to exhale fire from their mouths. Because of course it is.

boardgame.name: The Balthazar Stone
boardgame.description:
Can you unlock the ancient chest, find the Balthazar Stone and break the ancient curse?

Join Elsa Winslow on her journey to Sharktooth Island. To solve the mystery, you must unlock an ancient treasure chest, find Balthazar’s Stone and break its ancient curse.

Similar to an escape room game, this mystery presents you with a wooden chest locked a metal combination lock, and leaves you to work out how to open it and find and solve the mystery.

boardgame.name: Anvil Saga
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Anvil Saga is a management sim with RPG elements where you take control of a blacksmith shop amidst the Hundred Years' War. Each decision you make impacts the story and gameplay.Turn a ramshackle blacksmith shop into a successful enterprise in a challenging and endlessly varied world! Deal with local bandits, lords, priests, as well as French and English soldiers. Manage workers with various quirks, improve facilities and tools to create better merchandise, decorate your smithy to attract high-paying customers and most importantly – try not to get yourself beheaded.

Features

Build the smithy of your dreams

Construct new rooms and underground facilities in order to expand your smithy and take on the more challenging orders. From a simple workshop to living quarters, to a gym or a library – each room needs to be outfitted with the appropriate furniture and décor.
​
Make decisions and deal with the consequences

Customers, relationships and decisions – they all matter! Maintain your reputation with conflicting factions, each one offering protection and bonuses for your budding enterprise. The orders which you decide to fulfil and the way you deal with each faction influences the game world and leads to a variety of tragic, fun or bewildering outcomes.

Become a renowned craftsman

Manage orders and try to increase your prestige level to attract the rich and the famous. Look out for unique orders that pay a premium, such as a baron’s request to create the most beautiful ring for his daughter or the king's envoy demanding you forge a one-of-a kind sword.

Forge a team of professionals

Take charge of employees with different skill sets, salary levels, needs and personalities. Keep them happy by building special facilities, installing amenities and decorating their rooms. Equip your workers with special tools for faster work and help improve their craft by adding new books to your library.

Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Aquaculture Land: Fish Farming Simulation
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Aquaculture Land is a freshwater aquafarming management game with a sandbox-style mechanic and 2D pixel art visual design. Players will act like a businessman that runs a freshwater fish farm. They will manage all things related to fisheries, produce some high-quality commodities, fulfill the needs of customers, and diversify their business model.Key Features:


FISH FARMING. You can build your own pond for fish farming. You can manage your pond condition to meet the best condition for the fishes. Fish will get hungry sometimes. You can feed them to make sure they stay alive.
POND MANAGEMENT. To manage pond condition, you need to add some equipments such as aerator, purifier, and generator.
DIVERSE COMMODITIES. You can raise many types of fishes, crustaceans, and mollusks with each of its unique characteristics to create a diversity in their farm.
EMPLOYEE MANAGEMENT. Worker will do the farm job for you. By default, worker will automatically do their job such as maintaining equipments, feeding fish, etc. But you can choose whether make them stay self initiative or player-directed in doing something.
BUSINESS SIMULATION. Manage your resources efficiently and produce high-quality fish, crustaceans and mollusks to keep your business running. There are two options for you to get money. Customer order and market selling. First, you can take some order from customer that need some certain fish to be sold. Second, just check the market price statistics and look for what kind of fish that has the highest price, then raise that fish and sell it to the market.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series One
boardgame.description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 1 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
- Eurasia 120M BC
- Egypt 3100 BC
- Athens 400 BC
- Luna 3400 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
- Momochi Sandayu
- Fuma Kotaro
- Mochizuki Chiyome

boardgame.name: Behind the Frame: The Finest Scenery
boardgame.description:
Guide brush strokes and solve a variety of puzzles to help an aspiring artist complete her masterpiece amid her brusque neighbor’s gaze and his pesky cat. As her painting starts to take shape, uncover an emotional tale of chance and artistry revealed behind unrelated yet familiar moments.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Aquarium Designer
boardgame.description:
Live the life of a professional aquarium builder.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Pot o' Gold
boardgame.description:
Pot o' Gold is played with the provided board, two distinct dice, and a number of distinct tokens representing leprechauns: the rules recommend three for two players, four for three players, five for four or five players, and six for six players (or more, since there is no actual maximum player count).

Before each of three rounds players bet on one leprechaun to win and another as an alternate. Players then take turns rolling the dice, one of which always moves a leprechaun forwards and the other of which may move one backwards; the player rolling the dice decides which leprechaun(s) to move.

When a leprechaun reaches the end of the track it pays out: players who bet on it to win split a pot (100 times the round number) and players who bet on it as the alternate split a half-size pot. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.

boardgame.name: The Skull that Curses
boardgame.description:
From the description:

He won't stop yelling horrible things. The Skull demands mockery.

- Create insults suited for the Age of Moloch.
- Available in both full color and black/white for table use.
- Flavor your game with grotesque curses.

boardgame.name: Mayhem at Murkwood Manor
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A 1st-level Pathfinder 1E adventure in the frozen north! The PCs are in Baile, a town in the far north, and they are tasked with finding a community leader just days before the prominent harvest festival. Strange things have been seen and heard coming from Murkwood Manor, the large house that sits on the hill. Can the PCs uncover what has happened in time for the festival or will the community leader be lost to the town forever?

boardgame.name: 크라임 줌 (Crime Zoom)
boardgame.description:
크라임 줌 (Crime Zoom) is a compilation of four scenarios that were released separately (and one additional, entirely new scenario) in Crime Zoom Series in one box.

The included scenarios are:
-Case 1: 마지막 카드 (His Last Card)
-Case 2: 흉조의 전령 (A bird of Ill Omen)
-Case 3: 사라진 작가 (A Deadly Winter)
-Case 4: 러시안 모피 (No Fur)
-Case 0: 쓰러진 여자- New scenario (promotional stretch goal) from the publisher Delight.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Crime Zoom: Bird of Ill Omen

boardgame.name: Tiny Library
boardgame.description:
Tiny Library is a deck of 50 single-card RPGs from dozens of different creators.

Each card is a unique design representing a distinct vision.

Source: Kickstarter

boardgame.name: The Witchlight Carnival: Dice and Miscellany
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Premium dice and other goodies for the world’s greatest roleplaying game.

The wild, wonderful Witchlight Carnival travels from world to world, bringing the magic of the Feywild with it. Before you get your ticket, grab the right dice for the occasion.

Set Includes:

11 premium dice (two d20s, one d12, two d10s, one d8, four d6s, one d4)
Durable, felt-lined box that doubles as two dice trays
A beautifully illustrated, double-sided player-friendly foldout map with the Witchlight Carnival on one side and carnival concept art on the other
19 double-sided reference cards with descriptions and illustrations of characters, creatures, games, and other features of the Witchlight Carnival

boardgame.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Dungeon Kit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Delve into dungeons with this kit for the world’s greatest roleplaying game.

This kit equips the Dungeon Master with a screen and other tools that are perfect for running D&D adventures through dungeons, whether ruined or thriving.

The Dungeon Master’s screen features a painting of a fantastic vista that plunges into the deep reaches of a mountain. Useful rules references cover the screen’s interior, with an emphasis on dungeon-delving.


DM screen specially designed for dungeon delving, with tables for encountering monsters and exploring ruins and dungeons




Features 36 punch out dungeon geomorph cards with pathway connection points, perfect for planning a dungeon during game preparation or for coming up with a map in the middle of play




Customizable double sided dry-erase sheet offers unlimited versatility for tactical game play. Numbered grid for sketching maps on one side, and summary of the main actions a character can take in combat on the other




18 illustrated punch out condition cards, including mold and slime cards for dungeon encounters




9 punch out numbered and illustrated initiative cards to easily track the turn order for players, monsters, and nonplayer characters

boardgame.name: 50 Zombie Safe House Survivors 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This zombie outbreak lists contains 50 different survivors to stock your safe houses, encampments, and blocked off neighborhood sections. Also great for roaming packs of nomadic traveling survivors. Each entry contains the following: name (first and last), gender, age, prior role (before the outbreak), weapon, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: 50 Zombie Safe House Survivors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This zombie outbreak lists contains 50 different survivors to stock your safe houses, encampments, and blocked off neighborhood sections. Also great for roaming packs of nomadic traveling survivors. Each entry contains the following: name (first and last), gender, age, prior role (before the outbreak), weapon, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: 50 Roadside Motel Guests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different guests that you might find staying at a roadside motel. Included in each entry is first and last name (and sometimes a nickname), gender, age, role, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: 50 Ritzy Hotel Guests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different guests that you might find staying at a roadside motel. Included in each entry is first and last name (and sometimes a nickname), gender, age, role, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Flash Drive Contents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So your group of characters are looting out a location when one of them comes across a small hard drive. Does the thing still work? If so, what’s on it?

This 100 list is a collection of things that might be found on such a thumb drive. Some entries are possible clues or adventure hooks while many others are random junk. Suitable for a variety of role playing game settings, including modern/crime, post apocalypse, low level super hero, zombie outbreak, modern horror, early cyberpunk era, etc.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in a Modern Goth's Home
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So the characters are snooping around some goth’s place of residence looking for evidence of something– what all else do they find? This 100 list features a bunch of things that you might find in such a place– from pieces of possible evidence to basic everyday life stuff. Perfect for a variety of settings, from modern/crime to horror to zombie outbreaks to cyberpunk.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in a Modern Vampire's Home
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So your modern era detectives/vampire hunters have worked their way into the home of a suspected vampire. What do they find? Is there evidence or just junk collected over the years? This list provides 100 things that you might find in such a place. Some things point directly to the nocturnal activities of the vampire, other things are just associated with every day living.

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Cyber City Chatter V 12.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city overwhelms the senses. Neon against rainy black sky, reflecting in the puddles. Smells of things out of the sewers mix with the deep fried offerings of street vendors. Stale sweat so heavy in the air you can taste it. The most overwhelming of all is the sound… especially the endless sea of chatter. This list provides 100 random things that a group of heroes might hear in a cyberpunk city setting. Some things are worth taking note of, other things are just verbal garbage.

boardgame.name: Wasteland Scavenger Starting Loot Roller
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you’ve got a new wasteland survivor and the Game Master (GM) says that the character is allowed a small amount of starting loot. So what exactly do you have? Can you use all the stuff you’ve acquired or will some of it be worthy of bartering off for the things you need?

The Wasteland Scavenger Starting Loot Roller is a collection of 15 different loot charts that offer 20 different items each. There are quantity roll charts as well that help determine whether a character starts with one, two, or zero items from each loot chart. Many items are useful for all kinds of survivors while other things are good for trading in the wasteland settlements. These charts are also very useful for GMs wanting to flesh out the carried/worn equipment of randomly rolled non-player encounters.

The items presented in these roller charts are found in a typical modern setting. As such the charts are workable for realistic wasteland settings as well as mutant genre adventures and zombie outbreaks.

boardgame.name: d66 Village Quests and Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

36 random quests and encounters a party might be asked to undertake or deal with in a village or small town, suitable for fantasy settings generally. A power struggle between local leaders, a plague decimating the community, a missing hunting party, and a graveyard full of restless undead all await.

boardgame.name: Beneath Harlowe House
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Old Harlowe House at the edge of the lake sits in ruin, long since abandoned. Lady Harlowe has been missing for years, but! There are rumors that her vaunted silver hoards are still down there, available for the taking. Delving beneath the House is a messy, dangerous operation, but one that could yield huge rewards.

Beneath Harlowe House is a pamphlet dungeon: it all fits onto the front and back of a single piece of paper. There are about 30 rooms scattered across five different levels, with myriad connections, tunnels, and passages linking them all together. There are many monsters and treasures hidden within, plus all manner of other nasty ways for player characters to get mangled or die beneath the surface.

User summary:

See also Lowlife

boardgame.name: Lowlife
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lowlife is a toolkit for old-school RPGs about delving into tunnels, trenches, and mines.

Inside, you'll find:


Rules and procedures for caving, climbing, and tunneling
Hazards and dangers cavers might encounter beneath the surface
Monsters, plants, and fungi that dwell in and around the hills and caves
Items and tools to use for digging and surviving the tunnels
Generators and tools for building your own tunnel networks or modifying existing dungeons
Bits of aesthetic, flavor, and worldbuilding scattered throughout

boardgame.name: Rift to the Plane of Earth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rift to the plane of earth has been opened, descending down into misty darkness. Green crystals spread from that chasm outwards, contaminating the surrounding area as the plane of earth bleeds into the material realm.
The glowing emerald crystals coat the crumbling stone outcrops in the area, more forming every minute as the planes continue to merge unnaturally.
Directly surrounding the entrance to the plane of earth is a circle of engraved stone pillars, reflecting the lurid glow of the chasm. Beyond, a dying forest looms.

boardgame.name: Rift to the Plane of Air
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ground breaks away into the sky through this rift to the plane of air. Mist coils around the fractured entrance, and a shattered stone platform still hangs above it. It is engraved with strange arcane markings and surrounded by a circle of carved stones.

A depression in the earth leads down to the rift. Higher up stone outcrops overlook the entrance to the realm of sky, and green trees stand tall; their roots firmly planted in soil.

boardgame.name: Ravenswood Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Engraved stone pillars reflect the lurid red light of this demonic ritual site. Strange carvings at the center glow crimson, surrounded by a pool of rising blood. Red embers drift towards the grey sky, dissipating amidst the surrounding dying trees.
Crumbing stone columns surround this ritual site as it descends down into the earth. Earthen pathways lead down stone ledges to the ancient pit, where wildflowers wither and die.

boardgame.name: Portal to the Underworld
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The screams of tortured souls echo upward from this rift to the underworld. The circle of engraved stone pillars surrounding it reflect the rift’s blue light, green embers rising up towards a dark sky.
The surrounding forest is grey and dying, with a dusty dirt path leading down to the ritual site that opened the gate.

boardgame.name: Fey Wilds Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the midst of the strange fey wilds waits a ritual site. It is a depression in the earth, engraved with strange arcane markings and surrounded by a circle of carved stones.
Crumbing rocky outcrops border the area, with a dirt path leading down to the ritual site. Red and green trees surround the area, with unusual flowers coating the ground.

boardgame.name: Portal to the Outer Planes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the midst of a dying forest waits a portal to the outer planes. It is a depression in the earth, engraved with strange arcane markings and surrounded by a circle of carved stones.
Crumbing rocky outcrops border the area, with a dirt path leading down to the ritual site.

boardgame.name: Primitive Forest Village Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Primitive straw huts dot this forest village. At its center waits a blood-splattered arena, fortified with wooden stakes and fenced by a thick timber palisade. It is built into a gully with a stream running through it, so onlookers can watch the combat from cliffs and man-made viewpoints higher up.
The surrounding forest is lush and green, while broad leaved plants and shrubbery form the undergrowth. Alongside the river, out of the arena, strange prickly plants grow with red blossoms.

Adventure Seed

You are paid to find a valuable magic necklace set with amber stones. It’s a relic that was on an overdue caravan travelling through this area. If you search for it you’ll find the carts tipped over, spears and colorful arrows lodged in their sides. Broken crates are strewn along the ground, their contents spilling out. But the necklace isn’t there, nor anything else shiny.
Footprints churn the earth surrounding the caravan. They lead into the forest and if you follow them you’ll arrive at a timber palisade with large doors. Above the surrounding cliffs you can see straw huts, with primitive people standing outside and cheering at something beyond the fence. One of them sees you and screams, pointing, before four-dozen angry warriors emerge and surround you. They grin and bark in broken common to surrender.
If you do, they open the heavy doors and thrust you inside, barring them behind you. You see you’re in a pit with high walls and spot the bodies of dead caravaners littering the ground, covered in gore and churned soil. Another warrior is in there, his blades dripping crimson.
The cheering stops as a fat man begins speaking from a platform, surrounded by his comely sons, daughters, and wife. He announces that the man in the pit has shown promise and is well on his way to winning his daughter’s hand. He gestures to the one gorgeous woman on the platform, who is wearing the glowing amber necklace that you’ve been looking for.
If you survive the ensuing fight, guards will lead you away from the booing audience and down into a cave in one of the cliffs. Once there, you will be locked in cages, alongside other seemingly local warriors. If you talk to them, they will claim in broken common that none of them want to be there. That they were kidnapped from their villages and forced to fight.
One warrior, closest to your cage, will explain that he has fought three rounds and has been there for about two weeks. If asked why they don’t want to fight for such a beautiful woman he will give you an odd look and say “she has the ugly, I do not want to marry that”.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The chieftain’s ugliest daughter has been made beautiful by the necklace. Many of the warriors remember what she looked like before and don’t want her as a wife, which is why the village has resorted to kidnapping men for neighboring towns and bolstering their numbers by adding outsiders for entertainment.
If you win, your betrothed will stubbornly refuse to give you the necklace until married. When she takes it off her true hideous features will show, with an entitled personality to match. Unless you figure out how to ditch her, she will wish to follow her husband around wherever he goes—the locals do not want her and are eager to see her leave.

boardgame.name: Mana Wastes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing green mana crystals sprout from charred stone outcrops, destroyed by centuries of magical warfare. Eerie green water slithers through the wastes, undrinkable and vile.
The sand is blackened and charred, white bones cracking underfoot. The skeletons of trees loom overhead, clawing gnarled fingers towards the sky.

boardgame.name: Fire & Steel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing green mana crystals sprout from charred stone outcrops, destroyed by centuries of magical warfare. Eerie green water slithers through the wastes, undrinkable and vile.
The sand is blackened and charred, white bones cracking underfoot. The skeletons of trees loom overhead, clawing gnarled fingers towards the sky.

boardgame.name: Epic Dice Tower Defense: 5-6 Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds 6 neoprene play mats and a set of red and green dice for up to 6 players.

This was unlocked during the KS campaign.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With this pack, we are trying to fill some gaps in our library and also update the “Old” assets, bringing them up to our new standards.

We finally have some new Statues! Covering the basics first, such as Hooded figures, Knights, Basic shapes and Bases.
Total # of Assets in this pack: 312!

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 20
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

Additional batch of SRD Creatures.

This pack contains 8 new Creature Tokens, 4 Dragon Wyrmlings,1 Kobold and 3 Guard Drakes! each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 87!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Pack 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expansion of our vegetation!

We have new bush and tree variants, but more importantly a lot of Mushrooms! Both Large and Small, in many variants and colors!

Hope you’ll enjoy them

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1022!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Pack 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expansion of our vegetation!

We have new plant and tree variants, but also lily pads, cattails, long grass and flowers!

Hope you’ll enjoy them.

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1834!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Pack 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expansion of our Stones, Rocks and Boulders!

With couple of new exciting color variants.

New Matching cliff brushes and tiles are coming soon!

Hope you’ll enjoy them.

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1027!

boardgame.name: Manyūu Hiken-chō
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’ve entered a strange world jumper. Although the place looks like the Edo period of Japan (and in many respects certainly is) you’ll find numerous changes here, one of which is the most you are bound to notice immediately. The social status here seems to be dictated by one thing. We are talking tits here, mammaries, milkers, etc. More endowed women live in luxury while more flat-chested women live in poverty.

boardgame.name: Mario Tennis Aces
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Mario, Jumper! Half the time heroes and villains clash, deciding the fate of Kingdoms, and the other half they goof off playing sports or having parties. Right now, the world is in the latter phase, tennis is all the rage and Mario and the gang have left the Mushroom Kingdom to travel to an island famous for its tennis. It’s not all sunshine and roses however, as an ancient evil force known as Lucien has been unearthed by Wario and Waluigi. It will fall to Mario to stop this great evil, using his ever-improving tennis acumen.

You arrive in this world just after a corrupted Luigi leaves Marina Stadium. You will be staying here for the next six months, when this tennis craze will finally die down.

boardgame.name: Super Mario Sunshine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the sun-drenched tropical paradise of Isle Delfino! From Delfino Plaza, to Gelato Beach, to Pinna Park, this island is one of the finest vacation spots in the world! Unfortunately, it's very recently come into a bit of trouble. Some man who resembles Mario has been running around with a magic paintbrush covering everything in icky, paint-like goop with bizarre properties. But worst of all, he's stolen and scattered the Shine Sprites, the guardians of Isle Delfino and the source of its Sunshine. One hero will have to step up to the challenge of cleaning the island, gathering the Shine Sprites, and defeating this mystery man. That hero is Mario, so you can relax and enjoy yourself!

boardgame.name: Seoul Station's Necromancer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome back to Earth, jumper! No, you didn’t head home just yet, but this world is remarkably similar to your own, at least before the Dungeon Shock. In 2012, every subway station around the world overflowed with monsters, and in their place, portals were formed. Through each portal, a copy of the original subway station could be found, with monsters located within. If the dungeons aren’t cleared by killing the monsters within and getting the Return Stone to deactivate the barrier and leave, after 30 days the monsters will break out and likely destroy the surrounding areas before they can be put down. Fortunately, a new type of hero emerged. The Roused are those who have awakened abilities similar to RPG characters, and are considered the only people capable of clearing dungeons. This, combined with the mysterious Bloodstones found within monsters that can be used as an energy source, means that humanity can put up a good fight against the monsters. In five years, a mysterious man name Kang Woojin will return from another world and attempt to clean up the world himself.

boardgame.name: Word Explosion
boardgame.description:
UH OH! Games Presents, Word Explosion. Word Explosion is a highly explosive word game for 2 - 8 players that will challenge you like you've never been challenged before. Are you a teacher, spelling bee champ, master linguist, or just an average person who likes word games?

Word Explosion isn't just a word game, it's a strategy-based card game that will test your witts, vocabulary, knowledge of the alphabet forward and back, and your ability to sabotage your opponents to do whatever it takes to win.  
 
Players will take turns matching letters, continue the alphabet, spell words, or play action cards until they are the first to get rid of all their cards. Whatever method you prefer, be the first player to get rid of all your cards and be crowned the "Word Explosion Master."

boardgame.name: Loria
boardgame.description:
Loria is a homage to classics from golden era of strategy games, with modern spin on controls and user experience.

Game introduces not just RTS elements but also RPG elements such as: hero units, collecting items and quest driven missions offers for a more interesting take on the RTS genre.

Goal of Loria is to take the best concepts from the classics and create a modern user-experience, intelligent AI, smooth controls, pleasing aesthetic and to add interesting content.

Loria was made with passion and love of the RTS genre, that has given us so many hours of fun.
Hopefully we have managed to recreate the experience and fun.

Loria features:
2 playable races
2 campaigns with 8 missions each ( 16 missions in summary )
Entertaining story
Dozens of units, buildings and upgrades
6 unique heroes
Levelable heroes with backpack
Veteran units
Skirmish games

Source: The Game Presskit on it's website.

boardgame.name: Detention
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In DETENTION, you're an edgy alt kid (or a Prep) in a monster hunting high school who's been given a quota of monsters to kill or else face expulsion.

It's a GMless rules-lite game for the 2021 One-Page RPG Jam. It features 6 classes and a character sheet you can use as a bookmark.

boardgame.name: Under Pressure
boardgame.description:
From the description:

DETENTION: Under Pressure is a supplement for the edgy high school monster-hunter game DETENTION.

This supplement serves as an alternative way of making monstrous parasites, feeding off of teenage misery. You could probably make it fit with your high school monster game of choice.

boardgame.name: Ankh: Gods of Egypt – Upgraded Palace Board
boardgame.description: Kickstarter Exclusive upgraded component for Ankh: Gods of Egypt – Pharaoh. The Cardboard Palace Board replaces the thin one from the Pharaoh box.

boardgame.name: Les Aventuriers du Rail: Play Pink
Ticket to Ride: Play Pink
Wsiąść do Pociągu: Play Pink
Zug um Zug: Play Pink
¡Aventureros al Tren! Play Pink
boardgame.description:
Ticket to Ride Play Pink is a charity project in collaboration with Pink Ribbon, supporting breast cancer research around the world, led by Days of Wonder and Asmodee Belgium. In The Netherlands €4 per set and in Belgium € 2 per set sold will be donated to Pink Ribbon. The article contains a full set of trains that can be played with Ticket to Ride and Ticket to Ride: Europe in a new and unique pink color and a new shape wagons in a beautiful tin box.
80,000 Ticket to Ride Play Pink sets will be available during October known as Breast Cancer Awareness month.
Ticket to Ride: Play Pink is a limited edition Train & Station Set and will be available worldwide in the following countries: France, Netherland, USA, Italy, UK, Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Belgium, Spain, Romania, Poland, Canada, Brazil, Chile, Germany and China.

Released on Steam (currently Early Access) it's a game that focuses on 16 v 16 classic casual gameplay and intense action, 9 maps (in Italy, Germany, and Yugoslavia) and a historically authentic setting.

boardgame.name: Stworze: Odrodzenie – Mata
boardgame.description:

Size 63 cm x 63 cm.

boardgame.name: Cactus Town: Crazy Chicken Promo Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion allows your faction to use the force of some crazy chicken! Pick up a crazy chicken token at one of the new chicken locations and store it in your player area.

You can then "let it loose" in your turn, on a space orthogonally adjacent to any of your standees (maximum 1 chicken token in town at a time). It will go berserk in that space and expel all present standees. The standees move 1 space each, direction chosen by you. The chicken stays there until the end of the round and nobody may enter that building in that time. At the end of the round, the chicken token is discarded.

This mini expansion includes:
- 4 chicken building cards
- 4 crazy chicken tokens
- 1 rules card

boardgame.name: Turkic Monster Manual: A to B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I'm sure you had the chance to fight, chat and even make friends with many creatures from many mythologies during your sessions. Even in the Monster Manual, one of the most basic resources, there are traces of creatures from multiple mythologies. But until now, I have not been able to see anything belonging to Turkish Mythology in any official source, in a third-party book, or as the subject of homebrew.

As a Turk, I think we have very broad mythology, and for this reason, I wanted to present the main monsters that I think will add the most color to your games, in a series of five booklets. I hope you enjoy the monsters and the culture behind them, and you can learn more about mythology.

And finally; If you have trouble reading names, it's perfectly normal. Turkish can be a very difficult language for those who are not familiar with it.

boardgame.name: Jeralion the Centaur
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jeralion was born with a form of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome known in centaurs as Slough (/slo͞o/) Hoof, which causes fatigue and pain.

boardgame.name: The Dour Dowry
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wild Horses Couldn't Drag Him Away

A centaur must complete an impossible quest to gain his bride, but is he really the dark horse that can succeed?

This one-shot sidequest adventure is designed for 3-5 characters, level 2-3, with a total of 8-10 levels.

Make Lives Better through Role-Playing Games
This adventure is one piece of a movement within the D&D community to invite, encourage, and include those who have not been, both in the RPG community and nearly everywhere in real life. Wyrmworks Publishing is dedicated to using RPGs to help you make lives better, to provide tools, training, and a community to this end. We believe that this will extend far beyond the ever-growing RPG community as more and more people learn, grow, and give and receive acceptance.

To that end, this adventure includes disabled NPCs just like in real life, including a character with chronic fatigue syndrome.

This free adventure is formatted for the blind and visually impaired, including stat blocks and multiple NPCs, plus illustrations of each NPC.

Content Trigger Warnings
This adventure includes death and violence, family ableism, symptoms of pain and fatigue, and spiders.

boardgame.name: Murder House Contract
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new 2 to 4 hour adventure to be easily implemented into your campaign for levels 1 to 4.

Bounties have been posted!

boardgame.name: Murder in the Mists
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This murder mystery is a short adventure taking place in the Domain of Dread ‘The Carnival‘. It was written for APL 4.

After a pleasant evening at The Carnival, the characters find themselves in the middle of a murder investigation. It seems, that the Rabbitfolk Ruben Tenderly from the Litwick Market killed the beautiful tightrope walker Sarina Sirensong and as the suspect does not even try to defend himself, he is executed on the spot by Isolde, the Carnival’s leader. Was the executed fey creature acting on his own, was he part of a greater conspiracy or did Isolde railroad an innocent, driven by her grudge against the Litwick Market people? As the party unravels the mysteries, more bodies turn up. Is the murderer still on the loose or has the malicious deed summoned an even darker creature?
...
A 7-10h short adventure for APL 4, upscaling options included. can be run as standalone or dropped in any campaign setting with no effort.

boardgame.name: Lets Go Cadets!
boardgame.description:
In the year 2500 C.E. (more or less), humanity has become, let’s say, slightly clumsier and dull with the passing of time. Now, overwhelmed by the last Znorg’s invasion, humans are desperately looking for cadets up to the task. That is why you are here: a group of uncoordinated and undisciplined new recruits, yet committed with a selfless willingness to serve with enthusiasm and loyalty to “The Last Hope” left for humanity. Will it be enough?

A cooperative game from 2 to 4 players in a 30 minutes match on which you should manage “The Last Hope” spaceship while getting ready for the final battle against the Znorgs. Coordination, organization and teamwork are pivotal in order to survive in the ship. Will you be able to coordinate the numerous logistic tasks? Such as managing inventories, storing and keeping your food or even cleaning the bathrooms. Will you be able to do it while the occasional Znorgs’ inconvenient shenanigans disrupt the ship?

The game takes place during 3 stages where players will coordinate, upgrade ship modules and strengthen the team to defeat the Znorg in the Final battle.

The players will choose their dice simultaneously behind their screen. They will take turns declaring the number of the dice they are going to play, but not its color nor on which mission they will put them on to play. When everyone but the captain have declared their dice, the captain will say Lets, Go, Cadets! at which point everyone will simultaneously place their dice on a mission trying to fulfill the color and sum requirements, while trying not to damage the ship.

If players make it through the battle against the Znorg without destroying 4 ship modules, congratulations! You have saved humanity.

This game was the winner in the Party Games category at the recent Game Jam Latam Creativa 2021.

boardgame.name: ATOM RPG: Trudograd
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





A direct continuation of ATOM RPG, in which you will get to travel to Trudograd, a snowy post-apocalyptic megapolis that survived the destructive nuclear war and now stands tall among the wastes. It is said that the untouched depths of this city hold a mythical weapon which might soon become the only saving grace of the dying world. It is your goal to find and deliver it to ATOM, a secret organization formed by the top brass of the former Soviet Red Army. Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Asesino en Serie
boardgame.description:
Serial Killer - One of the players will become the assassin with an unassailable instinct that has been repressed until now. The assassin will convince one of us to become an accomplice in a terrifying scheme: to eliminate one by one, those who until now have been but friends. The Murderer and accomplice will have to go unnoticed in each crimes, hide their plans from their
prospect victims and proceed without leaving traces nor suspicions.
Will the targets be able to stop the murders in time? overcome their cunning, deception, and trickery of criminal duo? or will the killer and his accomplice end up unpunished and indulge in their bloodlust?

Asesino en Serie is a subtlety role game with three different game modes in the same box:


A deduction game for 2 to 4 players, with games lasting 10 to 20 minutes.


In this version each player will receive his role, and a hand of cards that he will have to declare face down, on 6 different columns that stand for 6 possible murders. Strategically they will be placing cards and activating destinies, which means revealing the cards of a column. If 2 or more bad intentions appear, it is considered a murder. If 3 murders are completed then Killer and accomplice wins the game. The murderer is caught when the detective appears at his destination, or both cards are in the same column.


An occult role-playing game for 5 to 10 players, with games ranging from 30 to 45 minutes.


This version of the game is a mafia-style subtlety role-playing game. The murderer and accomplices will succeed if the third murder occurs. If the murderer is caught, tried or killed both accomplice and murderer will have lost the game.


"Family size" version of the game for 6 to 12 players, designed to be played in real time with games lasting from 1 to 15 days.


In this version of the game, each player receives a card then leaves the scene with his role card in his pocket, wallet or wherever he prefers. The person with the killer card must choose an accomplice and kill one person per day by showing him the killer card. Interaction is done using the game's official medium, which is the "Serial Killer" mobile app. The way to win the game for the 3 other players is to accuse the killer or for the killer to kill at least half of the players.
